overview:
Business Line Management for new market segments and disruptive products.

Launched WD’s entry into the Enterprise SATA market, and led the creation of the Enterprise SATA segment. Enterprise SATA disrupted the Enterprise Storage market. Enterprise SATA is now 1/3 of the Enterprise HDD market.

Influenced the storage industry: wrote the original 13 use cases which influenced the direction of the SATA spec. Chaired one of the SATA standard working groups and served as technical editor for a ratified portion of the SATA industry standard.

Product Manager at Auspex, the company which competed with main-stream servers and created the File Server market segment.

Managed software team for NCRs failover clustering and Replication. at the time, both failover and replication for mid-range systems were disruptive technologies.

Published Author. “Serial ATA Storage Architectures and Applications” Co-Author. Intel Press. Going to print in late 2010 - “DataCenter Storage” published by CRC press

(ISBN 0-9717861-8-6 available on Amazon) Patent Holder - USPTO Patent 7,007,142 Network Data Storage-related Operations.

Specialties: Enterprise Storage Systems (NAS, SAN, iSCSI) and Storage Devices (HDD, SSD). Expert at bridging the gap between strategy and execution. Hands-on experience with: - Product Marketing - Servers, Networked Storage & Software - New product definition and development - Program management & project management - Outsourcing deal development and execution - Competitive analysis and competitive response - New product positioning, promotion & launch
